DOC.brief_title: A Biobehavioral Model Diabetes Risk Chinese Immigrants
DOC.detailed_description: It well-documented immigration US lead increase risk various chronic disease , include type 2 diabetes . The increase diabetes risk observe among Chinese immigrant primarily attribute change diet weight gain follow immigration , change partially explain disparity disease risk . Models immigrant health suggest stress adapt life new country considerable impact physical health . However , study consider psychosocial impact immigration upon biomarkers health disease risk . Therefore , longitudinal study US Chinese immigrant men woman examine : ( 1 ) whether psychosocial factor ( e.g. , acculturative stress , social isolation , discrimination ) associate marker type 2 diabetes risk time ; ( 2 ) whether association psychosocial factor diabetes risk marker mediate inflammatory pathway .
DOC.criteria: Chinese heritage ; migration Asia adulthood ( age 18 year old ) ; age 3565 year Current prior history diabetes Selfreported condition cancer , autoimmune disorder , HIV , psychiatric illness Use medication may impact study outcome ( e.g. , steroidal nonsteroidal antiinflammatory medication ) Inability provide inform consent .
